query: Q52. What does this command do?
options:
Accepts text from standard input and places it in "notes"
 Creates "notes" and exits
 Outputs the content of notes and deletes it
 Appends text to the existing "notes"

query: Q53. What is the output of:
code:
bash
VAR="This old man came rolling"
echo "\${VAR//man/rolling}"
options:
This old rolling came rolling
 This old man came man
 This old man came rolling
 This old came

query: Q56. What is the output of this code?
code:

query: Q57. What statement would you use to print this in the console?
options:
`echo "Shall we play a game? yes/\no"`
 `echo "Shall we play a game\? yes\\no"`
 `echo "Shall we play a game? yes\\no"`
 `echo "Shall we play a game? yes\no"`

query: Q58. Given a directory with these seven files, what would remain after executing these commands?

a

```bash
archive.tar
image1.gif
image1.jpg
image2.gif
image2.jpg
textfile1.txt
textfile2.txt
```

 b

```bash
archive.tar
textfile1.txt
textfile2.txt
```

 c

All of this files will be deleted

 d:

```bash
image1.gif
image1.jpg
image2.gif
image2.jpg
```
